Campus colors of Carnegie Mellon University (CMU), USA

Source: R/CMU.R
CMU_3_campus.Rd

CMU_3_campus provides six campus colors of the CMU, Carnegie Mellon University, USA.

Usage

CMU_3_campus

Format

An object of class character of length 6.

Source

Color definitions are based on the Color manual.

Value

A named vector of colors (HEX/HTML codes of type character).

Details

The Campus palette contains the following colors: "machinery_hall_tan" (defined as CMYK 15/15/30/15, RGB R188/180/158, HEX #BCB49E), "kittanning_brick_beige" (defined as CMYK 4/4/13/8, RGB R228/218/196, HEX #E4DAC4), "hornbostel_teal" (defined as CMYK 90/18/32/54, RGB R31/76/76, HEX #1F4C4C), "palladian_green" (defined as CMYK 47/6/28/18, RGB R113/159/148, HEX #719F94), "weaver_blue" (defined as CMYK 100/62/12/62, RGB R25/44/75, HEX #182C4B), and "skibo_red" (defined as CMYK 0/96/77/42, RGB R149/17/32, HEX #941120),

CMU_3_campus uses the HEX color definitions.

See also

CMU_1_core for core colors of CMU, Carnegie Mellon University; CMU_2_tartan for secondary colors of CMU, Carnegie Mellon University; seecol for viewing and comparing color palettes; usecol for using color palettes; simcol for finding similar colors; newpal for defining new color palettes; grepal for finding named colors.

Other U.S. university color palettes: CMU_1_core, CMU_2_tartan, asu_1, berkeley_1, berkeley_2, brown_1, brown_2, bu_1, caltech_1, caltech_2, caltech_3, chicago_1, chicago_2, columbia, cornell_1, cornell_2, cornell_3_accent, dartmouth_1, dartmouth_2, dartmouth_3, duke_1, duke_2, harvard_1, harvard_2, harvard_3, jhu_0, jhu_1, jhu_2, jhu_3_accent, jhu_4_gray, monash_1, monash_2, uci_1, uci_2, uci_3, uci_4, uflorida_1, uflorida_2, uflorida_3

Author

unicol, 2023-06-16.

Examples

CMU_3_campus
#>    machinery_hall_tan kittaning_brick_beige       hornbostel_teal 
#>             "#BCB49E"             "#E4DAC4"             "#1F4C4C" 
#>       palladian_green           weaver_blue             skibo_red 
#>             "#719F94"             "#182C4B"             "#941120" 
unikn::seecol(CMU_3_campus, main = "Secondary colors, Campus palette CMU") # view color palette
